description: Phase 2: Fix agent card grid vertical spacing. VirtualGrid passes gap to CSS grid (horizontal) but NOT to useVirtualizer (vertical rows touch). IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ (NOT root frontend/).

userStories.title: Add vertical gap to VirtualGrid virtualizer
userStories.description: As a user, I want agent cards in grid view to have consistent spacing between rows, not touching each other.
acceptanceCriteria: IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ (NOT root frontend/)
In virtual-list.tsx around lines 237-242, find the useVirtualizer config object
Add gap property to the useVirtualizer options: gap: gap (the gap prop is already passed to VirtualGrid as 24)
The @tanstack/react-virtual useVirtualizer accepts a gap option that adds spacing between virtual rows
After this change, vertical rows should have 24px gap matching the horizontal gap
Cards should no longer touch each other vertically
The estimateRowHeight (320px) may need adjustment to account for the gap -- verify visually
userStories.notes: Added `gap` property to VirtualGrid's useVirtualizer config at line 242. The gap prop (default 24px from caller) was already available but only used for CSS grid horizontal spacing. Now the virtualizer also uses it for vertical row spacing, ensuring consistent 24px gap between rows. Typecheck passes.
